My build is heavily optimized for Three of a Kind. I need to get a three of a kind to maximize my jokers.

**Remaining Deck:**
- 9s: 2 remaining (I could get a third 9)


- 6s: 4 remaining (I could get more 6s)

With one discard left, I should focus on completing a three of a kind. The 9s are my best shot since I already have a pair, and there are still two in the deck. Alternatively, the 6s have four copies remaining, giving me decent odds of drawing another one.

If I just play the pair of 9s without improvement, I'd only score 560 chips—nowhere near the 10,000 I need. A three of a kind is essential to reach my target.

With three 9s, I'd get 30 base chips plus 27 from the cards themselves. The multipliers stack significantly: base mult of 3, plus 12 from Zany Joker, plus 18 from Abstract Joker, and The Trio adds another X3 multiplier. Zany Joker's polychrome effect pushes the additive multipliers to 49.5, which combined with The Trio's X3 should get me much closer to the score I need.

If I add the 6♠ to the hand, the Wrathful Joker triggers for an additional +3 mult. This bumps my total additive multipliers to 36, which becomes 54 after the polychrome effect. The Trio multiplies that to 162, and 63 chips times 162 mult gives me just over 10,000 points.

Alternatively, playing the Jack with Sock and Buskin would retrigger it, effectively counting it twice. That setup yields 77 total chips and 148.5 mult, reaching 11,434.5 chips. My best path forward is using my final discard to hunt for a third 9, then playing all three with the Jack to maximize the retrigger bonus. I should discard the weakest cards—the 6♠, 7♣, 4♣, and 2♣ are all isolated and won't contribute to any scoring patterns. four of them to improve my odds of drawing a third 9 or a better card to pair with what I'm holding.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

(A♠) + 11 (A♦) + 10 + 10 (J♣ twice) + 10 + 10 (J♦ twice) = 82 chips total.

The multiplier comes to 2 + 3 + 18 = 23. Multiplying these gives 82 × 23 = 1,886 chips for this hand. Combined with my previous score, that puts me at 5,414 chips—still 4,586 short of the goal. I need to think strategically about my final hand and whether Acrobat's X3 multiplier could bridge that gap. Playing Q♣ alongside the jacks would create a pair instead, which changes the hand ranking. Playing this Two Pair now gets me 1,886, leaving 4,586 needed—which breaks down to roughly 61 chips required before the Acrobat multiplier kicks in. That's definitely within reach with a solid final hand.

I'll go ahead and play the Two Pair using all four cards. But I'm wondering if adding Q♣ as a fifth card makes sense, since it wouldn't contribute to the Two Pair scoring itself but could potentially retrigger Sock and Buskin as a face card. Looking at the rules though, cards outside the highest hand don't trigger any effects or add chips, so Q♣ would be dead weight. I'm sticking with just the four-card Two Pair.
